required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Protective Effect of Intraoperative Parathyroid Gland Auxiliary Recognition System in Thyroid Malignant Tumor Operation
clinical_study.official_title: Protective Effect of Intraoperative Parathyroid Gland Auxiliary Recognition System in Thyroid Malignant Tumor Operation

brief_summary.textblock: This intraoperative parathyroid gland auxiliary recognition system uses the principle of parathyroid gland autofluorescence to assist surgeons in accurately identifying and protecting parathyroid glands during surgery, reducing the possibility of postoperative hypoparathyroidism. This study will explore the protective effect of the parathyroid gland auxiliary recognition instrument on parathyroid function during thyroid malignant tumor surgery through reasonable grouping.

primary_outcome.description: Patients' serum Calcium level at 24 hours after surgery.
Patients' serum Calcium level at 1 month after surgery.
Patients' serum PTH level at 24 hours after surgery.
Patients' serum PTH level at 1 month after surgery.

arm_group.description: Identify the parathyroid glands through the experience of surgeons and assistance of instrument.
Identify the parathyroid glands only through the experience of surgeons.

intervention.intervention_name: Intraoperative parathyroid gland auxiliary recognition system
intervention.description: The enrolled patients are grouped according to whether or not to use the intraoperative parathyroid auxiliary recognition system.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with unilateral thyroid malignancies who require surgical treatment between the ages of 20-50.
2. No history of neck surgery and radiotherapy.
3. There is no evidence of parathyroid tumor invasion in preoperative imaging assessment.
4. No abnormal calcium metabolism disease.
5. No abnormalities in blood calcium and blood PTH before operation.
6. No allergy to contrast agents.
7. The patient or his agent signs an informed consent statement.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Does not meet the entry criteria;
2. Parathyroid glands were found to be invaded by tumor during operation and the parathyroid glands could not be preserved.
